text: Ralph Karl Winter Jr. (July 30, 1935 â€“ December 8, 2020) was an American politician and lawyer. He was born in Waterbury, Connecticut. He was known as a conservative judge. Winter was the judge of the U.S. Court of Appeals for the Second Circuit from 1981 until his death. He was nominated to the court by President Ronald Reagan. Winter Jr. died on December 8, 2020 in North Haven, Connecticut from esophageal cancer, aged 85.https://www.nytimes.com/2020/12/18/us/ralph-k-winter-jr-dead.html ==References== Category:1935 births Category:2020 deaths Category:American judges Category:Lawyers from Connecticut Category:Politicians from Connecticut Category:People from Waterbury, Connecticut Category:Republican Party (United States) politicians Category:Deaths from esophageal cancer
title: Ralph K. Winter Jr.
